modules.description: This module enables the construction of decision trees from integer-based datasets, supporting operations such as training set creation, feature bound definition, and classification of data points using generated trees. It also provides visualization capabilities through Dot format conversion, allowing analysis of tree structures in applications like predictive modeling with discrete integer features such as counts or categorical measurements.

This module provides operations for constructing decision trees from datasets containing both continuous (float) and discrete features, using the C4.5 algorithm. It supports creating training sets, defining feature properties, generating trees, and classifying data vectors, while enabling visualization through Dot file generation via custom-formatted tree representations. Key use cases include analyzing mixed-type datasets for predictive modeling and visualizing decision logic in classification workflows.

This module provides functions to build and analyze decision trees using the C4.5 algorithm, supporting datasets with mixed discrete and continuous features. It operates on training sets and decision trees, enabling feature definition, tree construction, and visualization in Dot format for classification tasks involving customizable continuous data types like integers or floats. Key workflows include training model initialization, feature bound configuration, and metadata extraction for categorical or numerical attributes.

This module implements the C4.5 algorithm for building decision trees from datasets with mixed discrete and continuous features. It provides functions to define feature types, construct decision trees, classify data points, and export trees in Dot format. It supports customization of continuous data types through functors and includes ready-to-use instantiations for integers and floats.
